Course Description:

Academic Reading Skills

Listening section measures your ability to understand conversations and lectures in English. The questions typically ask about the main idea and supporting details. Some questions ask about a speaker’s purpose or attitude. You will hear variety of conversations and lectures, each of which lasts from three to six minutes. Answer the questions based on what is stated or implied by the speaker. Throughout, this course you will also develop a skill of how to take note effectively. In many academic settings around the world, students are expected to read and understand information from textbooks and other academic materials written in English. The following are three purposes for academic reading:

 

Listening to catch information

● paying close attention for key facts and important information

● increasing the understanding and rate

 

Basic comprehension

● understanding the general topic or main idea, major points, important facts and details, vocabulary in context, and pronoun references

● making inferences about what is implied in a passage

 

Listening to catch

● recognizing the organization and purpose of a passage

● understanding relationships between ideas

● organizing information into a category chart or a summary in order to recall major points and important details

● inferring how ideas throughout the passage connect

 

Course Objectives:

The primary objective is to have skills for TOEFL-iBT Listening test. We focus on academic skills, time management, and inter-personal communication skills. Small and large group discussions are a part of classroom learning. All students are expected to pay attention during the listening tracks. Our class moves very quickly and covers a lot of material. Therefore, it is important not only that students keep pace with the course, ask questions and seek additional help when needed.

Mastering skills for the TOEFL iBT

The Official Guide to the TOEFL iBT

Course Policies and Expectations:

Course policies are the rules and guidelines our class follows. These policies are consistently enforces throughout the course and are reviewed at the beginning of each week. Each student is expected to know, understand and follow these policies. If you feel class policies need clarification, speak with me directly.

 

1.     Prompt daily attendance is expected. All students must be seated  in the classroom and prepared to learn when the time class started. Additionally, if a student is aware of up-coming absences, it is her/his responsibility to inform teacher before the absences and arrange make-up or alternative work. A friend in class is helpful to collect materials and information if you are absent.

2.     All readings and videos assignments indicated in the syllabus must be completed on the scheduled due date.

3.     You are a member of a community of learners. For any community to thrive, certain concepts must be embraced.

4.     All students must attend class every day and ready to actively participate daily activities.

5.     No distracting items are allowed in the classroom (i.e. headwear, chains, purses, electronic devices, phones, dogs, boyfriends/girlfriends!!)

6.     Appropriate language will be used in the classroom – no swearing or other offensive remarks will be allowed.

7.     You are responsible for your academic progress and communication with me about problems or struggles is expected from you.
